abstract: Google’s voice search service for the iPhone may signify an inflection point — speech recognition that is more useful than typing.
snippet: Google’s voice search service for the iPhone may signify an inflection point — speech recognition that is more useful than typing.
lead_paragraph: How do you talk to a search engine? In Googlish, of course.

headline.main: Google, iPhone and the Future of Machines That Listen

abstract: You take trivia answers that call for rapid-fire questions. You take a jumbo roulette wheel and the letters of the alphabet. What you’ve got are “Jeopardy!” and “Wheel of Fortune,” TV’s reigning syndicated shows for a quarter-century.
snippet: You take trivia answers that call for rapid-fire questions. You take a jumbo roulette wheel and the letters of the alphabet. What you’ve got are “Jeopardy!” and “Wheel of Fortune,” TV’s reigning syndicated shows for a quarter-century.
